page.title: 11WATER
page.content: The{1973}water act set up 10 water authorities in England and Wales. The Northumbrian is responsible for our "D" block water and sewage supply. The water collected from the ground is piped 80 miles from Kielder Dam. The main hazards of impure water are disease causing bacteria and viruses, lead and nitrates. The water is treated with chlorine.Every house in "D" block has an indoor tap water supply and sewage system. Most water is used for WC flushing{12%,}washing and bathing{9%,}laundry{5%,}washing up {3%,}carwashing and garden use{1%, drinking, food preparation and cleaning{7%.}Water is paid for by a water rate system although this is being reviewed and water meters may be installed. There is a small sewage pumping station in Kirklevington.
